Description: The chemical engineering master of science degree prepares students for exciting careers in a variety of industries, such as renewable energy, chemical manufacturing, biotechnology, and pharmaceuticals. The chemical engineering graduate program provides a curriculum that blends engineering fundamentals with emerging technologies. The core courses strengthen students' understanding of chemical engineering principles in thermodynamics, transport phenomena, kinetics, and applied mathematics. Electives in specialized areas allow students to build expertise related to their career goals. Students choose one of four areas of specialization: Advanced Materials, Biotechnology, Energy and Sustainability, or Transport Phenomena. Two options are available. The second option is a project track in which students complete a smaller scale research project that includes a final written report. The PhD in cognitive science provides students with a broad foundation across several core disciplines of cognitive science as well as deep knowledge in at least one area of specialization. Graduates will be well-prepared to apply computational and experimental methods in cognitive science to a range of problems in academic, industrial, and government settings.

Description: Lean Six Sigma is a disciplined, data-driven approach and methodology for eliminating waste in any process–from manufacturing to transactional and from product to service. The Lean Six Sigma advanced certificate provides students with an understanding of a variety of process improvement and statistical tools that are needed to successfully complete Lean Six Sigma projects. The program provides a pathway to Lean Six Sigma Green Belt or Black Belt certification. Certification is separate from the academic advanced certificate and is not managed by RIT.

Description:
RIT’s master of science in mechanical engineering allows you to gain a deep understanding of the theoretical and practical application of mechanical engineering. You will learn to apply principles of design, manufacturing, and analysis in a variety of specialized areas to meet the needs of industry and government.

RIT is internationally recognized for its career-focused education and has a long-standing relationship with a vast network of industrial and government partners. The MS in mechanical engineering reflects this focus. You will have opportunities to engage in applied research with a potential to disseminate your results in peer-reviewed journals and conferences.

The MS in mechanical engineering produces graduates who possess the skills and knowledge that are highly sought by industry and Ph.D. programs worldwide.

You may complete the degree through one of three options: A thesis option, a project option, or a coursework-only option.

Thesis Option: This option is oriented toward students with a keen interest in fundamental or applied research. It prepares you for work in research and development in industry, or for a Ph.D. degree. You will be required to develop, complete, and defend a research thesis to be published by RIT.

Project Option: This option is oriented toward students with an interest in applying engineering principles to solve challenging problems. It prepares you for work in product development and design in industry. You will be required to develop, complete, and defend an engineering project.

Coursework-only Option: This option is oriented toward students with an interest in broadening and deepening their knowledge in mechanical engineering in preparation for work in industry. This option is comprised entirely of course work.

Description: The master of science degree in technology innovation management and entrepreneurship is designed for individuals who want to manage technology and innovation and be an entrepreneur. Courses are focused in the areas of technology management, innovation management, leadership, and entrepreneurship. The MS degree is suited for students with backgrounds in business, engineering, science, or information sciences who want to pursue careers as technology managers, innovation managers, or entrepreneurs. The program provides students with the required knowledge to manage innovation and technology in an existing company, or to start their own business. It provides a unique mix of technology management, innovation management, and entrepreneurship topics. Students will gain an understanding of how to assess technology for commercialization potential, to strategically manage technology, and to implement technology for the purposes of new business development. The curriculum provides a balance between knowledge acquisition and application. A mix of cases, lectures, and projects offers opportunities to apply concepts to real-world business challenges. The MS program develops in students a solid foundation in business, an understanding of technology management and innovation, and an ability to be successful in the challenging business environment of the 21st century.

Description: The master of science for teachers in visual arts–all grades (art education) program is an teacher education program that leads to New York state initial and professional certification in visual arts for all grades (pre-kindergarten through grade 12). Description: In RIT's visual communication design MFA, you'll explore the rich legacy of visual communication design and its potential for positive social and global change. The program challenges you to delve into design for social impact, design for health and wellness, and other applications that address critical issues and serve the public good. The curriculum balances practice, theory, and research, equipping you with the tools to become a visual storyteller and a leader in the field. You'll learn to use visual language to inform, persuade, and inspire, while also gaining a deep understanding of the ethical considerations that shape the profession. Through a combination of coursework, research, and hands-on projects, you'll develop a strong portfolio and a clear vision for your future career.
